inclusion.criterion: Ages 5.0 to 9.99 years at time of screening.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Diagnosis of OSA with ADHD, OSA without ADHD, or non-snoring with typical development:
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Tonsillar hypertrophy ≥1 based on a standardized scale of 0-4 (0 = surgically absent;
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Deemed to be a surgical candidate for adenotonsillectomy for OSA by ENT evaluation
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Recurrent tonsillitis that meets published ENT clinical practice guidelines for surgery defined as: > 3 episodes in each of 3 years, 5 episodes in each of 2 years, or 7 episodes in one year.
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Craniofacial anomalies, including cleft lip and palate or sub-mucosal cleft palate or any anatomic or systemic condition which would interfere with general anesthesia or removal of tonsils and adenoid tissue in the standard fashion.
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Obstructive breathing while awake that merits prompt adenotonsillectomy in the opinion of the child's physician.
exclusion.label: triggers

notes: Patient has a history of COPD, OSA, and obesity hypoventilation syndrome. They have been experiencing agitation and altered mental status with hypoxia and O2 sats 70s on BipAp with 5L.
